data.title: Do i have friends ?
data.statement:
We are trying to determine whether two people are friends or not.

You are given two individuals [[name1]] and [[name2]].
The number of friend links [[n]], and for each link, a string of the form {{"name1->name2"}} explaining that name2 is a friend of name1. 


Two individuals [[name1]] and [[name2]] are mutual friends if and only if both of the links {{"name1->name2"}} and {{"name2->name1"}} exists.

Then if one of the links {{"name1->name2"}} or {{"name2->name1"}} exists, it is a unilateral friendship.

Otherwise they are not friends.


Names are separated with one arrow {{->}}. The names does not contain any spaces.
links can exist twice or even more

testCases.title: Example
testCases.testIn:
Amandine
Paul
6
Amandine->Paul
Matteo->Baptiste
Nicolas->Louise-Marie
Paul->Amandine
Gilles->Denis
Amandine->Louise-Marie

testCases.title: Validator 1
testCases.testIn:
Amandine
Paul
6
Amandine->Paul
Matteo->Baptiste
Nicolas->Louise-Marie
Paul->Amandine
Gilles->Denis
Amandine->Louise-Marie

data.constraints:
0 ≤ [[n]] ≤ 100
Every name is a single word and does not contain any space character
data.stubGenerator:
read name1:string(256)
read name2:string(256)
read n:int
loop n read linked:string(256)
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1 :>> The first name [[name1]].
<<Line 2 :>> The second name [[name2]].
<<Line 3 :>> The number [[n]] indicating the number of links.
<<Next [[n]] lines :>> [[linked]] containing the friendship links of the network.
data.outputDescription:
One of the three cases :
• {{mutual friends}} if [[name1]] and [[name2]] both consider each other as friends
• {{unilateral friendship}} if [[name1]] or [[name2]] is a friend of the other and not the other
• {{not friends}} if [[name1]] and [[name2]] aren't friends with each other at all

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

We are trying to determine whether two people are friends or not.

You are given two individuals name1 and name2.
The number of friend links n, and for each link, a string of the form "name1->name2" explaining that name2 is a friend of name1.


Two individuals name1 and name2 are mutual friends if and only if both of the links "name1->name2" and "name2->name1" exists.

Then if one of the links "name1->name2" or "name2->name1" exists, it is a unilateral friendship.

Otherwise they are not friends.


Names are separated with one arrow ->. The names does not contain any spaces.
links can exist twice or even more
Input
Line 1 : The first name name1.
Line 2 : The second name name2.
Line 3 : The number n indicating the number of links.
Next n lines : linked containing the friendship links of the network.
Output
One of the three cases :
• mutual friends if name1 and name2 both consider each other as friends
• unilateral friendship if name1 or name2 is a friend of the other and not the other
• not friends if name1 and name2 aren't friends with each other at all
Constraints
0 ≤ n ≤ 100
Every name is a single word and does not contain any space character
Example
Input
Amandine
Paul
6
Amandine->Paul
Matteo->Baptiste
Nicolas->Louise-Marie
Paul->Amandine
Gilles->Denis
Amandine->Louise-Marie
Output
mutual friends
